website_summaries.verdict: An activity station and a rolling walker in one, so your baby will love it both before and after they start walking. Just keep in mind the wheels can move very quickly on hard surfaces.
pros: Baby can push toy to the sound of music to practice supported walking
Can also sit on the floor to play with book pages, light up buttons, spinners and more
Assists in standing, walking, reaching and other gross motor skills
cons: Wheels do not lock and can move quickly on hard surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy until you read
customer_reviews.text: This has a major flaw in the flipping plastic pieces. My baby just started playing with it she is 9 months old and as she was playing with it she got her finger stuck in the gap and it ripped skin when she jerked it out. I didn't really ever notice the open area until after the incident. So I am writing review to hopefully save another baby from this pain
customer_reviews.author: john Sandusky

customer_reviews.title: I would love to give this 4 even 5 stars because my ...
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this 4 even 5 stars because my child loves playing with it....but the black stripes on the bottom smudge off when she put her mouth on it. Infants chew on everything and would never expect an infant toy to have paint that can be removed so easily. I'm in the process of wiping it all off so this doesn't happen anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: My pediatrician recommended to toss the walker and go get him one of these. He said putting them inside walker causes delay . I got my son this and he started walking in 3 days. He's only 10 months old BTW.
customer_reviews.author: Charmine

customer_reviews.title: Wheels have no resistance; not for kid who isn't sturdy on his/her feet
customer_reviews.text: Cute & fun toy for my 9 month old; ours loves the lights, music and all the activities on the front for play. Only problem is wheels spin freely with nothing hindering them from moving very fast out from under the kid. If you're counting on your not yet walker to use, make sure you're holding onto it at all times or it will go flying out from under them! My baby has ended up on the floor behind it since it got away from her.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Van

customer_reviews.title: Beware- wheels don't lock
customer_reviews.text: I have had two similar walking toys prior to this for my other kids and the wheels had locks to slow it down. This one does not. One speed only- FAST! If you have wood floors your kid will go flying. Not very helpful for anyone learning to walk. I guess I did not read the product description. Do not buy. Get one with the wheel locks and adjustable speeds.
customer_reviews.author: JennyO

customer_reviews.title: GO GO LITTLE BABY WALKER!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was so excited when I first put this together for her. It does require screw driver and come with what you need for assembly, but it's pretty easy. She loves it, and batteries aren't included. This was her when she first got a hold of it, pushed it around like a pro right away! Of course trying to show grandma the next day; not so much, but maybe she will grab it, and walk around like she did again tomorrow. Who knows, but the product is great, and she was happy.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I love this and so does my son
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this thing. It does need to be in carpet tho he has fallen once or twice trying to go on tile and hard wood with it. But it really is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have any kind of break system or different stages like most walkers has
customer_reviews.text: It is really light and doesn't have any kind of break system or different stages like most walkers has, my son couldn't control it. And I got scared that he would smash his face on the floor because it moves so fast when he pushes it. So I took of the walker part and just use the zebra as a toy.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Great forthe price
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loved using this when she was just learning to walk, at about ~10 months. She occasionally plays with it even now at 19 months. The songs are annoying as with many of these toys with sounds but it was worth it to see how much fun she had with this. There are fewer things to do on this than on the more expensive VTech walker but both entertained her. In my mind, the big advantage of the VTech is the phone, which is a lot of fun for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Literally had to break this open to put batteries in for my son. I get it open and see there’s a bolt or whatever it’s called on the other side so no way to open it without breaking it. Unfortunately i bought this 4 months ago before my son could use it and left it in the box until he could use it so too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Monica K

customer_reviews.title: Comment Edit!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. Be aware though, everytime you walk past it it'll start singing.. gets annoying when you have 2 big dogs playing rowdy in the house with a sleeping baby Haha. Edit: I've noticed it leaves some marks on the walls, it's not a big deal since it comes off easily with a Magic Eraser but thought I'd let you know.
customer_reviews.author: JNSRGC

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the walker you want to buy if you want something durable and sturdy but you don’t want to break the bank! I’ve seen a ton of walkers on here that are super expensive... this is a great price compared to others and it gets the job done! It has lots of fun things on the front including songs, buttons, and flashing lights. It is super sturdy so it won’t tip when baby is walking. Works on any floor type which is great for me because the first one we had didn’t work on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: AmberS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: Very basic toy but a thousand percent functional. My son showed no signs of walking and I bought this for him. Within 2-3 weeks he learned how to walk while holding onto the handle bar. It's easy to put together, the colors are nice and bright. Also very stable, doesn't tip over. I say it's a basic toy because it only has a few playing items on the face. If you are looking for a toy and walker in one, there are walkers that have a much more engaging face front (lots of buttons, music, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Tabeer Javed

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for 12-15 months!
customer_reviews.text: My niece loved it. She had just started walking when I gave her this, and she started running around pushing it all around the house. She also likes the music and the play station on the front. The toy is pretty sturdy mostly, but at times when my niece puts her full weight on it and runs with it, the bottom goes wider. It throws her balance a bit, but then she is a highly impatient toddler! Loved the price though, in comparison to certain exorbitantly priced contemporaries.
customer_reviews.author: SuburbanMom

customer_reviews.title: Learning to Walk for a GREAT Price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale on Amazon and wasn't sure how good this item would be for the price I paid. Of course, I'm almost always happy with anything Fisher Price and this item did not disappoint! Super easy to put together and once I added the batteries, it was fun to listen and play. My one-year old grandson is learning to walk and needed something to push around my house instead of the chairs. This was perfect and he would also sit on the floor and play with the lights and buttons. Great find!
customer_reviews.author: AZJENNIE13

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Faulty product couldnt get the battery door open without breaking it. Not sure if screw was stripped or what but it just didn't budge. We sell snap on tools so we clearly had the best and know how to use tools. If it werent such a hassle to return stuff i would just return it
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A.

customer_reviews.title: Boring/No locks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old. He lost interest in the activities on the front really fast. I think he only played with it a few times for a few minutes. Now he just uses it as something to hold onto when he stands up but I have to stay right there with him to make sure it doesn’t move because there aren’t any locks on the wheels. Spend a little extra $ and buy a more exciting walker with locks!!
customer_reviews.author: Boy Mom 👦🏻 👶🏻

customer_reviews.title: He is using this walker now and learning that he can move forward with this which is great practice for him walking across a room
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to my first grandchild Atticus. He loves this so much. He has been walking around the couch and table for a couple of months, but hasn't taken steps away from them. He is using this walker now and learning that he can move forward with this which is great practice for him walking across a room. He will be walking on his on very soon. It is adorable and has fun activities for him. Definitely a steal for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 9 month old who always wants to stand. This is perfect for a busy baby with the lights and sounds on the front. It rolls great on carpet and gym mats, not so good on wood floors. Definitely a great buy, as we use this daily and holds up to wear and tear
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: 10 month old grand daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got her this because she is walking but likes to have support I thought having this to hold on to would work great, but all the toys are on the front so she ends up there most of the time, hasn't figured out she can push from the back. she does love playing with it though and hopefully will grow in to it
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: Really makes my 11 month old son smile!
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered July 3rd- my son really enjoyed it without the batteries but once it lit up he was very scared of it. Today on August 17th he is just now smiling and liking it when it lights up. Now that he has come around he loves this thing. If your child doesn't like it- give it time!
customer_reviews.author: Brittanie

customer_reviews.title: Not as nice as I expected from photos but makes sense for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as I expected from photos but makes sense for & $11 that I paid. It's very cute and toddler loves it even after he walks on his own. Likes it better than heavy duty one that was probably 3 times the price. Also very good for being able to maneuver without be good at steering yet.
customer_reviews.author: Leahonamazon

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but I miss the old version
customer_reviews.text: My first child had the lion one a few years ago, and honestly I liked that version better. It didn’t talk, just played music. This one talks in that annoying new fisher price voice. But my new kiddo seems to like it. It has a cute little “book” on the front and plenty of things to touch. He’s only used it to walk once but as he gets closer I think it will get more use.
customer_reviews.author: Ru

customer_reviews.title: Great toy - be careful on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: This toy is WONDERFUL! My baby loves practicing walking behind it. It might be too lightweight for wood/linoleum floors, but it works great on carpet. He is able to put his weight on it without flipping backward. The only trouble he had was it flipping back when he tried to put up on it from a sitting position directly under the handle.
customer_reviews.author: CandaceR

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I knew when before I press "paid" that it would be shipped in alternative packaging but never did I thought it would be a clear plastic bag. I cleaned all the parts and set it up for my 9 month baby boy and he loves it. The activities come through very clear (he be stopping and looking underneath were the voice coming from) lol. It's a good toy to gift and or purchase.
customer_reviews.author: The Diva

customer_reviews.title: Cute but there are better ones out there
customer_reviews.text: This slips forward really fast/easily so my baby is quick to fall. It’s also not particularly sturdy, so again with the falling. The sounds are cute but I feel like other walkers I looked at had more activities on the front too. Over all it’s okay, especially if you can get a good price, but I would recommend shopping around first
customer_reviews.author: sonja :)

customer_reviews.title: Best 20 bucks I’ve spent in a while
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy is so close to walking, but won’t try it alone. So we’ve been hunching over holding his fingers to help him. Enter this thing. Assembly was quick, less than 5 minutes. Batteries not included. He loves the buttons on the front. He walked with it for more than a half hour yesterday and then even took one step on his own! I did notice the front wheels don’t spin well on wood floors, but this thing transfers from rugs to wood easily. He’s handled the faster speed ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it. It was one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It was one of the cheapest walkers we could find and we have had several people compliment it when they see our son using it. I have had two friends by this for their children because others that they saw were made from cheaper material and were not nearly as cute.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Great product my daughter uses it all the time, only thing is that if your baby is like mine it may roll too quick if they are starting to attempt to walk with it. I stuck foam pads in between the wheels and the wheel attachment to slow it down. Very light and you have to make sure your child doesn’t push too hard and flip over it. Other wise 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jose Soto

customer_reviews.title: Very basic
customer_reviews.text: Having seen now seen the vtech earlier in person, I wish I had gotten that instead. This walker has 5 things for a baby to fidget with but only one of those trigger a sound. There's more on the vtech walker. Also, the vtech has brakes on the wheels. This doesn't so it will roll away if she leans on it when playing with the front.
customer_reviews.author: Poe Ella

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great toy but not so much for younger babies. My almost 9 month old has a lot of trouble keeping his balance to actually walk because there's no resistance whatsoever when he pushes so he falls and hits his head on the toy a lot. For an older kid with more balance I think it'd be great though.
customer_reviews.author: Chaely

customer_reviews.title: Helped my granddaughter learn to walk!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 1yo granddaughters 1st birthday. She is now 18 mo., was liking evertywehere and still loves to pllsy with it! Great toy for a lil. one. A always Fischer Price is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Erlinger

customer_reviews.title: Good walker
customer_reviews.text: Love this little walker, my baby started at 9 months and now he’s 11 months and he’s almost walking. At first it was hard for him to get the hang of it but fast forward a couple of weeks and he’s now an expert and he loves it! I would recommend getting this walker if you have carpet because I’m floor the wheels go a little too fast and an inexperienced baby will fall and hurt themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Vilma carrillo

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Was Afraid my son wouldn’t like the push walkers but he LOVES this walker so much. More then anything lol. He loves walking on his own his other walker he sits in didnt last very long before he started climbing out of it . Should it just got this and saved 60$ He learned to push it within a few weeks and now is running with it at ten months old
customer_reviews.author: Aggie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it teaches fine motor skills but it rolls too fast for her when on wood floors so I had to put hot glue on the back wheels ( 2 strips going around the wheel) this helped grip the floors and slow it down for her
customer_reviews.author: mpless

customer_reviews.title: I cannot reccomend this walker at this time because I feel it is a tripoing hazzard
customer_reviews.text: While cute as can be I find this walker to be a tripping hazard... The legs are way to wide and my grandson tripped over it many times... He does however enjoy the activity board. He likes the music and the touchable parts that click and clank and flip... You might want to consider a redesign making the legs no so wide.
customer_reviews.author: like or dislike?

customer_reviews.title: Perf
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old loves this thing! We’re hoping he walks by his first birthday with the help of this toy. It’s lightweight and compact so we take it to grandmas house all the time. He turns it with ease and keeps him entertained. I didn’t wanna spend too much due to us hoping he doesn’t use it for too long Great buy
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and great price!
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves this toy! It's so cute. It starts singing or galloping if it's slightly touched, which is great because I'll be in the kitchen and I can hear where my little one is playing. Even our older children like this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would consider buying if I had carpet floors.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sounds and options for thee baby to play with. As a walker, not so good. If you have carpets it might work fine, but the wheels don't have any grip at all. With a few DIY improvements I was able to give some friction to the wheels to avoid the walker to just slip forward.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: Kiddos love it. Both my babies took their first steps with one. Not very parent friendly. If your floor shakes this thing will start singing. Imagine waking up in the night walking to your kitchen and this thing starts singing. It's been kicked a few times but it very durable.
customer_reviews.author: D'Vawn Banks

customer_reviews.title: Grandson likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 9 month old grandson. He loves it. He sits and plays with the various activities on the front. He does not walk yet, so is not able to stand and push it from behind. The only problem with the unit is there is no locking mechanism for the wheels, so the child definitely needs to know how to walk before trying to stand with assistance from the handle in back.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Edens

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loves this! She's not yet walking, but started to pull up around 11-12 mos, and loves to cruise around after her older sibling with this. Cute, durable, music isn't too annoying (but it does require a screwdriver and some assembly, so just factor that in).
customer_reviews.author: K99JS06

customer_reviews.title: The wheels don't work great with hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 8 month old who is starting to pull up and trying to walk. She is currently not playing with this because it moves way too much while she's sitting or standing. She's hit her head several times on it. I'm hoping once she's walking and more stable she can use it. The wheels don't work great with hardwood floors. I'm going to try to put hot glue on them to keep the toy from flying out beneath her.
customer_reviews.author: Tflo

customer_reviews.title: Baby walker
customer_reviews.text: Got it when my baby boy was 10 months old. He would play with it before he started using it as a walker. Sound effects are good and still work on it. Deff a good investment for helping them start to walk. He's almost 14 months and loves to run around the house with it in full speed. Buy your baby one!
customer_reviews.author: Samari Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons was learning to walk. His pediatrician recommended skipping the traditional walker and going for one on this style. It did the trick, he started taking steps and walking in no time. Purchased two.
customer_reviews.author: Temeka Wood

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for babies starting to walk.
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 9mo and she is desperate to walk. She spends all day standing up holding on whatever she can find, so i thought this walker would be the perfect aid. But on the contrary, this thing is not sturdy, she easily flips it over and falls badly. Not suitable for babies that haven't mastered walking yet.
customer_reviews.author: Camila

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece! She is starting to try to walk and this helps so much and also provides fun learning and entertainment! So many of my friend’s kids have this and rave about how much of a hit it is!!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler's
customer_reviews.text: My daughter love this walker. She will be 1 years old this month. She is struggling to walk, but this been helping her. I like how the toy play music while she is pushing it. She love it and so do I. I do recommend this walker, it's has many good benefits to help your infant / Toddler
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dagrin

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: There are other walkers with more things to do, but I really only needed this as a walker, I have many other fun toys. You can't beat this price. My son isn't walking yet, he 6 months and enjoys it, especially the spinning ball.
customer_reviews.author: Nissy

customer_reviews.title: Not for my kids!!!
customer_reviews.text: Came with missing screws my babies can't use it. They're learning to walk but this is makes them fall. I really don't like. It seems to be a popular toy but for me it's an accident waiting to happen. I plan on returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Happy nephew, happy me!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves it so much!! I got it for him when he was about 8 months old so he wasn’t trying to walk with it yet, but definitely entertained himself with the activities on the front part. Now that he is a year old, he will crawl all the way across the house to get to it, pull himself up to use it, and have the best time walking back and forth across the house (with a lil help turning) with it! It was a great buy, one of his favorite toys right now. It works well on both carpeted and tiled floors.
customer_reviews.author: JWo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walker
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to put together and had minimal pieces. My son hasnt yet tried to walk around but loves the buttons and music. The wheels have no way of locking so i suggest proping it against something or to supervise your child if they arent a confident walker yet. My son and i loce this walker so far.
customer_reviews.author: Janie Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for building baby confidence
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this. It is definately easier for her to push on Carpet as it doesnt slide away as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Olivas-Arreola

customer_reviews.title: Amazing purchase
customer_reviews.text: My little girl refused to use any other potty chair for the longest. I saw this online and just gave it a shot. Ever since it arrived shes been using it! It makes her feel so secure and safe! It's really sturdy and so easy to put up and take down. Great purchase!!! I would reccomend it to any parent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My twins love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have twins, but I bought only one because I wasn't sure if I was going to get a good quality. I mean, the price is great, and I couldn't believe it was the actual fisher price brand! I will definitely buy another one! My babies love it, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Moves too fast
customer_reviews.text: If this zebra didn’t move to fast for a beginning walker, it would be an almost perfect toy. However the wheels move way to fast for a beginning walker. My LO has fallen face first many times because the wheels move faster than his little legs allow him to go. It’s great when he is sitting to play with it, just so long as it is backed up to a wall.
customer_reviews.author: candierain8

customer_reviews.title: Cute for babies just learning to walk in need of support
customer_reviews.text: Very cute toy for babies up to about 9 months old or right before they start walking. My nephew loved it but then lost interest in it once he started walking at 9 months and didn’t need the support anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ola

customer_reviews.title: Zebra Activity Center
customer_reviews.text: This zebra activity center and walker was a great christmas present. My granddaughter who is 13 months loves it. She can dance to the music and push/lean on the walker. Great present and cute toy
customer_reviews.author: clgitsme

customer_reviews.title: Zebra Walker
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to a great granddaughter who is 11 months old. Her mother tells me she pulled herself up and took 3 steps. Great for a little one under a year old. It was well received and very appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: NJGiGi

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old has a lot of practice with this walker and now he’s almost completely walking!!! He loves playing with the buttons. Loves the colors and music/sounds it plays. I’m glad I bought this for him and I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tylaa

customer_reviews.title: runs away with the baby had to discontinue
customer_reviews.text: Makes baby drop because it has zero resistance. I guess they think everyone has carpets?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kids like it
customer_reviews.text: My daughters 1 and 3 years both like it lol. The sounds are cute and repetitive of course, but the wheels move a little too fast and loose and it glides across our wood floor way to fast for her doesn’t help her walk only if she’s standing there still it’s some what supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Adriena l.

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are slippery
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are completely plastic and too slippery for my child to grab a hold and stand up with it. The walker just keeps sliding with no sort of resistance. He’s tried other walkers, which have had rubber in the wheels and those have provided some resistance and don’t slip around like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The wheels do no lock or slow down.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that the wheels don’t lock or slow down, how is my baby suppose to learn how to walk. He fell flat on his face several times. This is not a considered walker . Only if your baby already can walk. I wish I could have returned it because it’s only functional to play the activities on the front . I already installed it and threw out the box. Because there were so many reviews I didn’t think to question it. And I’m very surprised why anyone would like it .
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Simple push toy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent push toy for those that want some playing out of it(activities on the front) without that being the main part. My 9 month old instantly figured out what it was for and has been walking all over with it without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Darling and absolutely spellbinding for my niece!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best gift I could have given my niece for her 1st birthday! she wouldn't even look at her other presents as she explored all of the features and began to walk behind it...the only thing is that she suddenly stops and dances with the music and I have almost bumped her several times. Great product at a great price. Can't say enough good things....
customer_reviews.author: Carla Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous when I ordered this because it was a lot cheaper than comparable items, however, I couldn’t be happier. It was easy to assemble and my daughter loves it. It really is helping her learn to walk on her own, and she loves the front part that plays music.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbles0104

customer_reviews.title: and sturdy enough. Fun stuff
customer_reviews.text: Cute, and sturdy enough. Fun stuff. .... BUT way too easy to push for babies/toddlers who are just learning to walk. REALLY rolls -- no tension at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute and easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! My 8 month old loves it. A tad bit Cheaply made and that’s my only complaint. When screwing in the screws the plastic didn’t handle great with the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: The Woods

customer_reviews.title: Wheels don’t lock.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this, I got it as a Christmas present for my nephew. But the one major downfall it has is that the wheels don’t lock, so it makes it hard when he’s sitting and goes to grab it to try to stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Walking toy
customer_reviews.text: Walking toy.. grandson walks with it quite well.. their floors are concrete so at first it would get away from him a bit, but he learned quickly how to control it.
customer_reviews.author: sdavis1209

customer_reviews.title: It’s her favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Took my 9 month old a while to get the hang of it. I do wish I had gotten one where the wheels lock or have different speed settings. It slides a lot on wood floors. After a month of practicing, this is now my little one’s favorite toy. She does laps around the house all day.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice if all the parts were included!
customer_reviews.text: This product requires assembly but not all the parts were included. No screws were included in the packaging. My husband spent 1/2 an hour trying to find screws around the house to put it together. Luckily he found some or we would have had a very disappointed little one. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Lou

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading and buy it already
customer_reviews.text: Little one loves walking around with this and not only that, but she really enjoys playing with the lights and sounds at the front of the toy. I would’ve definitely gotten this sooner if I had known about this item. Such a great product and a must have for any little beginning to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas J.

customer_reviews.title: Babies love it, parents will get sick of the sounds
customer_reviews.text: My five stars is from my baby’s perspective. She loves this thing. She claps when it plays its songs, and uses it to walk all around our apartment. Do I love it when this thing declares “I’m a zebra! I have striiiiipes”? No. The sounds are pretty annoying. But it makes my baby very happy, so five stars. She also will use it without the sound.
customer_reviews.author: queen of spain

customer_reviews.title: Fun and practical
customer_reviews.text: My baby absolutely loves this toy!! It makes some cute sounds and keeps him entertained! It’s also a good height and sturdy for him to walk with.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby learning to walk
customer_reviews.text: Our little man loves this! He is learning to walk and can go so fast holding onto it. He is able to pull himself up safely and go! He loves the music that plays as he walks and sits in front of it and plays with the various toys.
customer_reviews.author: K&J Smith

customer_reviews.title: very Effective
customer_reviews.text: my son has started to use this as a walker and he gets the exercise he needs and the walker does what it suppose to. Worth it for the price!

customer_reviews.title: Whach him walk
customer_reviews.text: This really kelp the little one get started on walking. In a week and a half he was going across the floor first pushing then wow he was walking.
customer_reviews.author: lorrie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn’t like about this item was the box it came in. I bought as gift and it came in a plain brown box that was very unappealing. Otherwise the toy inside was great.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandson who turned 6 months old. Before it was assembled, he was playing with wheels. And then loved the zebra part with activities. He’s not ready to walk yet, but he loves to do the activities and music.
customer_reviews.author: Julie ONan

customer_reviews.title: If it had original box it would be best
customer_reviews.text: I got disappointment when it camed usually in store it would be in original box this time it was just in amazon box you can give it as gift i did not have any choice but i got emberessed
customer_reviews.author: Nurdiyor

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: The item looks just as pictured. It was easy to assemble and seems of good quality. I think it's a great deal for the price. My 9 month old seems to like it although she hasn't yet started to push it but the music, sounds and buttons fascinate her.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has been starting to work on walking so I thought this would be fun for him. He enjoys sitting in front of it and playing with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and my nephew immediately smiled and started playing with it (4mo old). Love that he can use it and grow with it
customer_reviews.author: Coral13

customer_reviews.title: Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and good interaction. I wish there wheels had a bit more resistance. Also one of the stickers started peeling off after just a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Brittyk

customer_reviews.title: Nice but baby can feel scared to use it for walk
customer_reviews.text: Baby show interest in this toy but sometimes feels scare about using it to walk. The toy doesn't have any kind of resistance or break to walk slowly so it can go away from your baby and let her going down.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Faraco

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the wheels
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new toy but my problem are the wheels, they are too smooth and it moves too fast when he's trying to walk with it which makes him fall. If you guys can do something about these wheels, that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVED this gadget
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this gadget. We have a 9 MONTH old Grand Baby that is "Early walking" but she still needs stabilization. This is great on CARPET to keep her upright until she is able to handle the non carpeted floor. Doesn't tip over but still needs adult guidance near if they are beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Metro Resellers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy!!! Hes 9 months and he uses it to get from place to place in the house lol
customer_reviews.author: Just Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Cute Zebra Walker
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my granddaughter. We gave her a baby shower with a zoo theme and this little zebra fits PERFECTLY with all of the other items that we got her. A walker plus a bonus activity toy!
customer_reviews.author: WeekendWarrior2017

customer_reviews.title: Daughter uses it all the time
customer_reviews.text: Great walker! Light weight and compact compared to other walkers we looked at. It has just enough bells and whistles to be fun. My three year old will sit and play with it as well as my 1 year old. It sings a song when being pushed to encourage baby to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Eusebius

customer_reviews.title: My 10 month old LOVED this & helped her to walk on her own!
customer_reviews.text: My now-11 month old looooves this! I named it "Zippy" & when I say, "Go get Zippy" she will look around & then go to it. I think this also helped her develop her walking skills. She is walking 100% independently around the house now. I gave her this just before she turned 10 months old, for Christmas. She immediately was able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for sure
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and my son loves walking around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a friend's son's first birthday. He had just started walking. He went straight for this and walked it around most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was his first time playing it and couldn’t stop! I tried to put other toys in front of him but he wasn’t going lol. I really like this toy! I just wish the sound was just a little bit louder.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: For how inexpensive this was, I was not expecting something to be of such great quality! My 8 month old loves this toy. He doesn't walk with it yet but loves to sit by it and stand holding onto the handles.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: My 9month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little toy. I’ll be happy when my son actually uses it to walk😆 he can stand on his own but we need to take that first step. As of now he just flips it over and spins the wheels and plays with the table. I was afraid that it wouldn’t be sturdy but the assembly is very easy and yes you need a screw driver and it holds the baby’s weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Gave these for gifts to my two grandsons. They are sturdy and well made. Can’t wait to see them walking behind them.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita Stevens

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We got it for my son when he was 11 months old and didn't start walking yet. He had a lot of fun holding it and learning to stand while pushing it. He is 26 months old now and still loves his zebra! It's the best investment we have made in a toy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Blanca Mendizabal

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Learn with Me Zebra Walker
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFrom teaching first words to encouraging first steps, the Fisher-Price Learn with Me Zebra Walker is the kind of first friend you want for your little one! Spin, flip, roll, twist. This zebra’s full of busy, hands-on activities for sitting babies. Your baby can turn the book page or press the light-up buttons to hear all about letters and numbers through sing-along songs and phrases with new animal friends! And when baby’s learning to walk, the easy-grasp handle and sturdy 4-wheel base help steady those wobbly first steps. “Keep going!” Lots of fun phrases, music and songs invite and reward even more moving and grooving – helping little ones get even steadier on their feet!

BRAND STORY
By Fisher Price
feature_bullets: Musical infant walking toy with 2 ways to play as your baby grows: Sit & play and Stand & Walk
Hands-on activities for sitting babies plus light-up buttons to press for sing-along songs and phrases
Fun phrases, music and sounds help reach the alphabet, numbers and more
Easy-grasp handle and sturdy 4-wheel base help steady baby’s first steps
For babies ages 6 months and older

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,043 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
